name: Diabetes
description: A chronic condition that affects blood sugar.
fullDescription: Diabetes is a disease that occurs when your blood glucose, also called blood sugar, is too high. There are two main types: Type 1 and Type 2. Treatment involves managing diet, insulin levels, and lifestyle.

name: Asthma
description: A condition that causes breathing difficulties.
fullDescription: Asthma is a condition in which your airways narrow and swell and may produce extra mucus, leading to difficulty breathing. It can be triggered by allergens, exercise, or stress.

name: Hypertension
description: High blood pressure affecting blood vessels.
fullDescription: Hypertension is a chronic condition in which the blood pressure in the arteries is persistently elevated. It can lead to severe complications if not managed properly.

name: Arthritis
description: Inflammation of joints causing pain and stiffness.
fullDescription: Arthritis refers to a group of more than 100 conditions that affect the joints, leading to pain, swelling, and stiffness. It can affect anyone and is commonly seen in older adults.

name: Chronic Kidney Disease
description: Progressive loss of kidney function over time.
fullDescription: Chronic kidney disease (CKD) is a long-term condition where the kidneys do not work effectively. It can be caused by various factors, including diabetes and high blood pressure.

name: Alzheimer's Disease
description: A progressive disease that destroys memory.
fullDescription: Alzheimer's disease is a progressive neurological disorder that causes the brain to shrink and brain cells to die. It affects memory, thinking, and behavior.

name: Parkinson's Disease
description: A disorder of the central nervous system.
fullDescription: Parkinson's disease is a progressive neurological disorder that affects movement. It develops gradually, often starting with a tremor in one hand.

name: Osteoporosis
description: Weakening of bones, making them fragile.
fullDescription: Osteoporosis is a condition in which bones become weak and brittle. It is often called a 'silent disease' because bone loss occurs without symptoms.

name: COPD
description: A group of lung diseases that block airflow.
fullDescription: Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) is a lung disease characterized by chronic obstruction of airflow that interferes with normal breathing.

name: Stroke
description: Damage to the brain from interruption of blood supply.
fullDescription: A stroke occurs when the blood supply to part of the brain is interrupted or reduced, preventing brain tissue from getting oxygen and nutrients.
